text: John August Antonelli (April 12, 1930 â€“ February 28, 2020) was an American professional baseball player. He played for the Boston and Milwaukee Braves, New York and San Francisco Giants, and Cleveland Indians between and . He later became a six-time National League All-Star, a two-time 20-game-winner, and the leader of the 1954 world champion Giants' pitching staff. He batted left-handed, stood tall and weighed . Antonelli died on February 28, 2020 in Rochester, New York of cancer, aged 89. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in New York (state) Category:Boston Braves players Category:Businesspeople from Rochester, New York Category:Sportspeople from Rochester, New York Category:Cleveland Indians players Category:Milwaukee Braves players Category:San Francisco Giants players
title: Johnny Antonelli
